edu.ucla.sspace.clustering

Class Assignments

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.Assignments
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Assignment>

    public class Assignments
extends Object
implements Iterable<Assignment>
    The return value for all Clustering implementations. This class records the number of clusters created, the assignments for each value, and helper methods for constructing the centroids of a cluster.
    Author:
    Keith Stevens

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Assignments(int numClusters, Assignment[] initialAssignments)
      Creates a new Assignments instance that takes ownership of the initialAssignments array.

      Creates a new Assignments instance that takes ownership of the initialAssignments array.
      Assignments(int numClusters, int numAssignments)
      Creates a new Assignments instance that can hold up to numAssignments Assignments.
      Assignments(int numClusters, int numAssignments, Matrix matrix)
      Creates a new Assignments instance that can hold up to numAssignments Assignments.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Assignment[] assignments()
      Returns the array of Assignment objects.
      List<Set<Integer>> clusters()
      Returns the data point indices assigned to each cluster.
      int[] clusterSizes() 
      Assignment get(int i)
      Returns the Assignment object at index i.
      DoubleVector[] getCentroids()
      Returns an array of dense centroid vectors of each discovered cluster which are scaled according the the number of data points asisgned to that cluster.
      SparseDoubleVector[] getSparseCentroids()
      Returns an array of sparse centroid vectors of each discovered cluster which are scaled according the the number of data points asisgned to that cluster.
      Iterator<Assignment> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the Assignment objects stored.
      int numClusters()
      Returns the number of clusters.
      void set(int i, Assignment assignment)
      Sets Assignment i to have value assignment.
      int size()
      Returns the number of Assignment objects stored.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Assignments

        public Assignments(int numClusters,
           int numAssignments)
        Creates a new Assignments instance that can hold up to numAssignments Assignments. This assumes that the data matrix will not be accessible. Calls to getCentroids() will fail when using this constructor.

      • Assignments

        public Assignments(int numClusters,
           int numAssignments,
           Matrix matrix)
        Creates a new Assignments instance that can hold up to numAssignments Assignments.

      • Assignments

        public Assignments(int numClusters,
           Assignment[] initialAssignments)
        Creates a new Assignments instance that takes ownership of the initialAssignments array. This assumes that the data matrix will not be accessible. Calls to getCentroids() will fail when using this constructor.

      • Assignments

        public Assignments(int numClusters,
           Assignment[] initialAssignments,
           Matrix matrix)
        Creates a new Assignments instance that takes ownership of the initialAssignments array.

        Returns the number of Assignment objects stored.

        public int numClusters()
        Returns the number of clusters.

      • assignments

        public Assignment[] assignments()
        Returns the array of Assignment objects.

      • clusters

        public List<Set<Integer>> clusters()
        Returns the data point indices assigned to each cluster.

      • getCentroids

        public DoubleVector[] getCentroids()
        Returns an array of dense centroid vectors of each discovered cluster which are scaled according the the number of data points asisgned to that cluster. Note that this method assumes that the original Matrix holding the data points contains rows of feature vectors.

      • getSparseCentroids

        public SparseDoubleVector[] getSparseCentroids()
        Returns an array of sparse centroid vectors of each discovered cluster which are scaled according the the number of data points asisgned to that cluster. This assumes that the original Matrix is sparse. Note that this method assumes that the original Matrix holding the data points contains rows of feature vectors.

      • clusterSizes

        public int[] clusterSizes()
